help.title: Help
help.para1: Parameter reports enable users to generate reports based on individual criteria provided by input from the user. For example, a sales analyst runs a sales report to view data for the entire country, a particular state, or for the analyst's own territory. The sales analyst can query data for specific time periods such as the past quarter or the past week. You use parameter fields to create a flexible report that adapts easily to input from each of the sales analysts. The user then provides personalized parameter values to generate the report.
help.para2: Parameters support restricting the values available to the report user, by displaying a list of values from which the user must choose. You can set parameters of text data type as masked. This setting displays asterisks instead of the text typed by the user when running the report. You should not display the values of parameters set as masked in the report output.
help.para3: You can specify the format in which date and date-time parameters to match the short date setting of the report user's computer or to appear as an explicit format string. When you use the format of the short date setting, default values and any values in the restricted list of values for a date parameter appear in the short date format of the user's computer. If you set an explicit format, the values appear in that format, irrespective of the settings on the user's computer.
help.para4: You can further customize Boolean parameters by selecting their appearance as a list, a radio set, or a check box. A check box displays only the parameter's description, or its name if the description is empty. The other appearance settings also display the true and false values. You can supply custom text which appears for the true and false values. For example, a report which shows bank accounts could have a Boolean parameter for account balance which appears as In credit and Overdrawn, as shown in the following illustration, instead of true and false which are difficult for the report user to interpret.
